definition: to prey on the people
surname Yu
fish/CL:條|条[tiao2],尾[wei3]
meat/flesh/pulp (of a fruit)/(coll.) (of a fruit) squashy/(of a person) flabby/irresolute/Kangxi radical 130
surname Bai
hundred/numerous/all kinds of
family name/surname/CL:個|个[ge4]/to be surnamed

sentences.english: They were like devils preying on the people in the past.
sentences.chinese: 在过去他们凶神恶煞般地鱼肉百姓。

sentences.english: There Saint Martha is said to have captured a monster terrorising its people.
sentences.chinese: 据说正是在那里，圣玛莎制服了一个鱼肉百姓的怪物。

definition: corruption and abuse of the law (idiom); to take bribes and bend the law
grasping officials, corrupt mandarins (idiom); abuse and corruption
to oppress the people/to act tyrannically
to tax by force and extort levies (idiom); to screw taxes out of the people by force
to break the law and commit crimes (idiom); malefactor/evildoer/to perpetrate outrages
to have disregard for human life (idiom)
a corrupt official
lit. the fat and wealth of the people (idiom); the nation's hard-won wealth (esp. as an object of unscrupulous exploitation)/the people's blood, sweat and tears
corrupt official/grasping functionary/greedy mandarin
with no regard for law or discipline (idiom); flouting the law and disregarding all rules/in complete disorder
to gang up for personal interest (idiom)/to form a clique
tyrannical abuse (idiom); riding roughshod over people
evil tyrant
evil gentry/wicked landlord
not to shrink from any crime (idiom); to commit any imaginable misdeed
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
